001package gust.backend.transport;
002
003import com.google.api.gax.core.CredentialsProvider;
004import com.google.api.gax.core.ExecutorProvider;
005import com.google.api.gax.grpc.*;
006import gust.Core;
007import gust.backend.runtime.Logging;
008import io.grpc.Channel;
009import io.grpc.ClientInterceptor;
010import io.grpc.ManagedChannel;
011import io.micronaut.aop.MethodInvocationContext;
012import io.micronaut.context.annotation.ConfigurationProperties;
013import io.micronaut.context.annotation.Context;
014import io.micronaut.core.annotation.AnnotationValue;
015import io.micronaut.runtime.context.scope.Refreshable;
016import org.slf4j.Logger;
017import org.threeten.bp.Duration;
018
019import javax.annotation.Nonnull;
020import javax.annotation.Nullable;
021import javax.annotation.concurrent.Immutable;
022import javax.annotation.concurrent.ThreadSafe;
023import javax.inject.Inject;
024import javax.inject.Singleton;
025import java.io.IOException;
026import java.util.*;
027import java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentMap;
028import java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentSkipListMap;
029import java.util.concurrent.ScheduledExecutorService;
030
031
032/**
033 * Supplies a {@link TransportManager} implementation for dealing with Google Cloud APIs via gRPC and Protobuf. In this
034 * object, we make heavy use of the Google API Extensions for Java ("GAX"), in order to centrally manage channels, on-
035 * demand, for downstream service use.
036 *
037 * <p>Connection instances may be requested from this object like any other transport manager, but if there is an
038 * existing managed channel for the provided service ID, it will provide the existing instance (or one from a pool of
039 * existing instances) rather than creating a new one.</p>
040 *
041 * <p>To request a connection instance from this transport manager, annotate an injectable method parameter (or
042 * constructor parameter) of type {@link Channel} with {@link GoogleAPIChannel}. For example:
043 * <code>
044 *   public void doSomething(@GoogleAPIChannel(Service.PUBSUB) Channel pubsubChannel) {
045 *     // ...
046 *   }
047 * </code></p>
048 *
049 * <p><b>Configuration:</b> Each Google service has a specified <i>name</i>, included on the docs in
050 * {@link GoogleService}, at which that service may be configured in <pre>application.yml</pre>. For example, the
051 * following code configures the Cloud Pubsub client's keepalive and pool size settings:
052 * <code>
053 *   transport:
054 *     google:
055 *       pubsub:
056 *         poolSize: 3
057 *         keepAliveTime: 15s
058 *         keepAliveTimeout: 30s
059 *         keepAliveWithoutCalls: true
060 * </code></p>
061 */
062@Context
063@Singleton
064@Immutable
065@ThreadSafe
066@Refreshable
067@SuppressWarnings("unused")
068@ConfigurationProperties(GoogleTransportManager.CONFIG_PREFIX)  // `transport.google`
069public final class GoogleTransportManager implements TransportManager<GoogleAPIChannel, GoogleService, Channel> {
070  /** Prefix under which Google services may be configured. */
071  public final static String CONFIG_PREFIX = ROOT_CONFIG_PREFIX + ".google";
072
073  /** Logging pipe. */
074  private final static Logger logging = Logging.logger(GoogleTransportManager.class);
075
076  /** Maximum number of concurrent connections per service. */
077  private final static int DEFAULT_MAX_POOL_SIZE = 3;
078
079  /** Tag to append to the user-agent on outgoing calls. */
080  private final static String GUST_TAG = "gust/" + Core.getGustVersion();
081
082  /** Thrown when required transport configuration is missing. */
083  private static final class TransportConfigMissing extends TransportException {
084    /**
085     * Instantiate a new `TransportConfigMissing` exception.
086     *
087     * @param svc Service we are missing config for.
088     */
089    private TransportConfigMissing(@Nonnull GoogleService svc) {
090      super(String.format(
091        "Google transport configuration could not be resolved for service %s.", svc.getToken()));
092    }
093  }
094
095  /** Thrown when credentials are required, but missing. */
096  private static final class TransportCredentialsMissing extends TransportException {
097    /**
098     * Instantiate a new `TransportConfigMissing` exception.
099     *
100     * @param svc Service we are missing config for.
101     */
102    private TransportCredentialsMissing(@Nonnull GoogleService svc, @Nullable IOException ioe) {
103      super(String.format(
104        "Google transport credentials could not be resolved for service %s.", svc.getToken()), ioe);
105    }
106  }
107
108  /** Exception thrown when a channel could not be established. */
109  private static final class ChannelEstablishFailed extends TransportException {
110    /**
111     * Instantiate a new `ChannelEstablishException` exception.
112     *
113     * @param svc Service that failed to establish a connection.
114     * @param ioe Wrapped IO exception.
115     */
116    private ChannelEstablishFailed(@Nonnull GoogleService svc, @Nonnull IOException ioe) {
117      super(String.format(
118        "Failed to establish a connection to Google service '%s'.", svc.getToken()), ioe);
119    }
120  }
121
122  /** Client header interceptor for injecting the framework `User-Agent` header. */
123  @Immutable
124  private static final class UAInterceptor extends GrpcHeaderInterceptor {
125    /** Singleton interceptor instance. */
126    private static final UAInterceptor INSTANCE = new UAInterceptor();
127
128    private UAInterceptor() {
129      super(Collections.singletonMap("user-agent", GUST_TAG));
130    }
131  }
132
133  /** Wrapper object that manages a set of pooled connections. */
134  @Immutable
135  private final static class ManagedChannelPool {
136    /** Known service we will be managing connections for. */
137    private final GoogleService service;
138
139    /** Holds the set of channels managed by this pool. */
140    private final InstantiatingGrpcChannelProvider provider;
141
142    /**
143     * Initialize a new managed connection pool for the provided service configuration.
144     *
145     * @param maxPoolSize Maximum per-service pool size.
146     * @param executorService Executor service to use for spawning work.
147     * @param svc Service which we will be managing connections for.
148     * @param config Configuration by which to initialize gRPC channels.
149     */
150    private ManagedChannelPool(int maxPoolSize,
151                               @Nonnull ScheduledExecutorService executorService,
152                               @Nonnull GoogleService svc,
153                               @Nonnull GoogleTransportConfig config) {
154      this.service = svc;
155      this.provider = buildProvider(maxPoolSize, svc, executorService, config);
156    }
157
158    /**
159     * Acquire a managed channel from this pool, potentially blocking until one is ready or otherwise free. If all
160     * channels are busy, and the maximum number of channels has not yet been reached, one may be established fresh for
161     * the invoking caller, which may also incur delays.
162     *
163     * @return Managed channel acquired for the service configured with this pool.
164     * @throws ChannelEstablishFailed If an I/O error occurs establishing or resolving the requested channel.
165     */
166    @Nonnull GrpcTransportChannel acquire() throws ChannelEstablishFailed {
167      try {
168        if (logging.isDebugEnabled())
169          logging.debug(String.format("Acquiring connection for service '%s'...", this.service.getToken()));
170
171        // acquire the channel
172        GrpcTransportChannel channel = (GrpcTransportChannel)this.provider.getTransportChannel();
173        if (channel == null || channel.isShutdown())
174          throw new IllegalStateException("Failed to acquire gRPC channel (or was initially shut down).");
175        else if (logging.isDebugEnabled())
176          logging.debug(String.format("gRPC channel acquired ('%s').", channel.getChannel().authority()));
177        return channel;
178
179      } catch (IOException ioe) {
180        logging.error(String.format("Failed to establish managed channel (error: '%s').", ioe.getMessage()));
181        throw new ChannelEstablishFailed(this.service, ioe);
182      }
183    }
184  }
185
186  /**
187   * Build the provided {@link GoogleTransportConfig} into a gRPC channel provider, which applies the configuration when
188   * instantiating channels according to needs invoked through the active {@link TransportManager}.
189   *
190   * @param maxPoolSize Maximum size of the channel pool.
191   * @param service Service for which we are building a channel provider.
192   * @param executorService Executor service to make use of when executing RPCs.
193   * @param config gRPC configuration to apply when instantiating new channels for this service.
194   * @return Pre-fabricated provider instance to use when instantiating new channels.
195   */
196  private static InstantiatingGrpcChannelProvider buildProvider(int maxPoolSize,
197                                                                @Nonnull GoogleService service,
198                                                                @Nonnull ScheduledExecutorService executorService,
199                                                                @Nonnull GoogleTransportConfig config) {
200    if (logging.isTraceEnabled())
201      logging.trace("Setting up new gRPC channel provider...");
202    // begin setting up provider
203    InstantiatingGrpcChannelProvider.Builder builder = InstantiatingGrpcChannelProvider.newBuilder()
204      // target
205      .setEndpoint(Objects.requireNonNull(config.endpoint(),
206        "Managed channel endpoint cannot be null."))
207
208      // message sizes
209      .setMaxInboundMessageSize(Objects.requireNonNull(config.maxInboundMessageSize(),
210        "Maximum inbound message size cannot be null."))
211      .setMaxInboundMetadataSize(Objects.requireNonNull(config.maxInboundMetadataSize(),
212        "Maximum inbound metadata size cannot be null."))
213
214      // pooling & execution
215      .setPoolSize(Math.min(
216        Objects.requireNonNull(config.getPoolSize(),
217          "Cannot set `null` for max pool size."),
218        maxPoolSize))
219
220      .setExecutorProvider(new ExecutorProvider() {
221        @Override
222        public boolean shouldAutoClose() {
223          return false; /* this executor is shared, so don't auto-close per-service. */
224        }
225
226        @Override
227        public ScheduledExecutorService getExecutor() {
228          return executorService;
229        }
230      });
231
232    // interceptors
233    if (logging.isTraceEnabled()) logging.trace("Applying extra interceptors...");
234    Optional<List<ClientInterceptor>> extraInterceptors = config.getExtraInterceptors();
235    if (extraInterceptors.isPresent()) {
236      List<ClientInterceptor> extraInterceptorsList = extraInterceptors.get();
237      final ArrayList<ClientInterceptor> composedInterceptors = new ArrayList<>(
238        extraInterceptorsList.size() + 1);
239      composedInterceptors.add(UAInterceptor.INSTANCE);
240      composedInterceptors.addAll(extraInterceptorsList);
241      builder.setInterceptorProvider(() -> Collections.unmodifiableList(composedInterceptors));
242      if (logging.isDebugEnabled())
243        logging.debug(String.format(
244          "Custom interceptors added (%s), along with `UAInterceptor`.", extraInterceptorsList.size()));
245    } else {
246      builder.setInterceptorProvider(() -> Collections.singletonList(UAInterceptor.INSTANCE));
247      if (logging.isDebugEnabled())
248        logging.debug("No custom interceptors detected. Added `UAInterceptor`.");
249    }
250
251    // keepalive
252    if (logging.isTraceEnabled()) logging.trace("Applying keepalive settings...");
253    if (Objects.requireNonNull(config.getKeepaliveEnabled())) {
254      builder
255        .setKeepAliveTime(Duration.ofSeconds(config.getKeepaliveTime().getSeconds()))
256        .setKeepAliveTimeout(Duration.ofSeconds(config.getKeepaliveTimeout().getSeconds()))
257        .setKeepAliveWithoutCalls(config.getKeepAliveNoActivity());
258      if (logging.isDebugEnabled())
259        logging.debug(String.format(
260          "Managed channel keepalive is ENABLED with (%s) time, (%s) timeout.",
261          config.getKeepaliveTime().toString(),
262          config.getKeepaliveTimeout().toString()));
263    } else {
264      if (logging.isDebugEnabled())
265        logging.debug("Managed channel keepalive is disabled.");
266    }
267
268    // credentials
269    if (logging.isTraceEnabled()) logging.trace("Applying credential settings...");
270    Optional<CredentialsProvider> maybeProvider = config.credentialsProvider();
271    if (Objects.requireNonNull(config.requiresCredentials()) && !maybeProvider.isPresent()) {
272      logging.error(String.format(
273        "Failed to initialize gRPC service '%s': credentials were required, but could not be obtained.",
274        service.getToken()));
275      throw new TransportCredentialsMissing(service, null);
276    }
277    if (maybeProvider.isPresent()) {
278      if (logging.isTraceEnabled()) logging.trace("Found credential provider. Resolving...");
279      try {
280        builder.setCredentials(maybeProvider.get().getCredentials());
281        if (logging.isDebugEnabled()) logging.debug("Credentials were resolved and attached.");
282      } catch (IOException ioe) {
283        logging.error(String.format(
284          "Failed to initialize gRPC service '%s': credentials were specified, but failed to load.",
285          service.getToken()));
286        throw new TransportCredentialsMissing(service, ioe);
287      }
288    }
289
290    // connection priming
291    if (Objects.requireNonNull(config.enablePrimer())) {
292      if (logging.isDebugEnabled()) logging.debug("Connection priming ENABLED.");
293      builder.setChannelPrimer(managedChannel -> primeManagedChannel(service, config, managedChannel));
294    } else if (logging.isDebugEnabled()) {
295      logging.debug("Connection priming DISABLED.");
296    }
297    return builder.build();
298  }
299
300  /**
301   * Prime a managed gRPC channel, once it has been established by the underlying GAX tooling.
302   *
303   * @param service Service which we are instantiating a channel for.
304   * @param config Configuration for our gRPC service channel.
305   * @param channel Instantiated/established connection and higher-order RPC channel.
306   */
307  private static void primeManagedChannel(@Nonnull GoogleService service,
308                                          @Nonnull GoogleTransportConfig config,
309                                          @Nonnull ManagedChannel channel) {
310
311  }
312
313  /** Map of pooled connections, grouped per-service. */
314  private final ConcurrentMap<GoogleService, ManagedChannelPool> poolMap;
315
316  /** Maximum size of any one service connection pool. */
317  private volatile int maxPoolSize = DEFAULT_MAX_POOL_SIZE;
318
319  /** Executor service to use for RPC traffic. */
320  private volatile @Nonnull ScheduledExecutorService executorService;
321
322  /**
323   * Initialize a new Google Transport Manager.
324   *
325   * @param executorService Scheduled executor against which to execute RPC traffic.
326   */
327  @Inject
328  GoogleTransportManager(@Nonnull ScheduledExecutorService executorService) {
329    if (logging.isTraceEnabled())
330      logging.trace(String.format("Initializing `GoogleTransportManager` (version tag: '%s').", GUST_TAG));
331    if (logging.isDebugEnabled())
332      logging.debug(String.format("`GoogleTransportManager` executor: '%s'.", executorService.getClass().getName()));
333    this.poolMap = new ConcurrentSkipListMap<>();  // initialize pool map
334    this.executorService = executorService;
335  }
336
337  /**
338   * Generate or otherwise resolve a transport-layer configuration for the provided <pre>service</pre>. This includes
339   * stuff like the actual endpoint to connect to, keepalive configuration, retries, pooling, and so on.
340   *
341   * @param service Service for which we should generate or acquire a transport config.
342   * @return Transport configuration for the specified service.
343   * @throws TransportConfigMissing If configuration cannot be resolved.
344   */
345  private static @Nonnull GoogleTransportConfig configForService(@Nonnull GoogleService service)
346      throws TransportConfigMissing {
347    if (logging.isTraceEnabled())
348      logging.trace(String.format("Resolving configuration type for Google service '%s'...", service.getToken()));
349    Optional<Class<GoogleTransportConfig>> cfgType = service.getConfigType();
350    if (cfgType.isPresent()) {
351      Class<GoogleTransportConfig> cfgTypeClass = cfgType.get();
352      if (logging.isDebugEnabled())
353        logging.debug(String.format("Configuration type resolved as '%s'.", cfgType.get().getName()));
354      // create config instance
355      try {
356        return cfgTypeClass.newInstance();
357      } catch (InstantiationException | IllegalAccessException err) {
358        logging.error(
359          String.format("Failed to resolve configuration for Google service '%s'.", service.getToken()));
360        throw new TransportConfigMissing(service);
361      }
362    }
363    throw new IllegalStateException(
364      "Failed to resolve configuration type for service '%s'. It may not be implemented.");
365  }
366
367  /**
368   * Resolve a managed channel for the provided Google API service, according to the provided transport configuration,
369   * which contains transport-layer settings to apply when establishing new connections for this service.
370   *
371   * @param service Service to establish or otherwise resolve a connection for.
372   * @param config Configuration to apply when establishing connections for this service.
373   * @return Managed channel, established for the provided service.
374   * @throws ChannelEstablishFailed If a channel cannot be established.
375   */
376  private @Nonnull GrpcTransportChannel resolveChannel(@Nonnull GoogleService service,
377                                                       @Nonnull GoogleTransportConfig config) throws TransportException {
378    if (logging.isTraceEnabled())
379      logging.trace(String.format("Resolving managed gRPC channel for Google service '%s'.", service.getToken()));
380
381    final @Nonnull ManagedChannelPool pool;
382    if (!poolMap.containsKey(service)) {
383      if (logging.isDebugEnabled()) logging.debug(String.format(
384          "Connection pool not found for service '%s'. Establishing...", service.getToken()));
385
386      // establish initial pool of connections
387      pool = new ManagedChannelPool(maxPoolSize, executorService, service, config);
388      poolMap.put(service, pool);
389    } else {
390      if (logging.isTraceEnabled()) logging.trace(String.format(
391        "Connection pool found for service '%s'. Using existing.", service.getToken()));
392      pool = Objects.requireNonNull(poolMap.get(service));
393    }
394    return pool.acquire();
395  }
396
397  // -- Getters & Setters -- //
398
399  /** @return Maximum size of any one service connection pool. */
400  public int getMaxPoolSize() {
401    return maxPoolSize;
402  }
403
404  // -- Public API -- //
405  /**
406   * Acquire a connection from this transport manager. The connection provided may or may not be freshly-created,
407   * depending on the underlying implementation, but it should never be <pre>null</pre> (exceptions are raised instead).
408   *
409   * @param type Type of connection to acquire. Defined by the implementation.
410   * @return Connection instance for the desired service, potentially fresh, potentially re-used.
411   * @throws TransportException If the connection could not be acquired.
412   */
413  @Override
414  public @Nonnull Channel acquire(@Nonnull GoogleService type) throws TransportException {
415    //noinspection ConstantConditions
416    if (type == null) throw new IllegalArgumentException("Cannot resolve connection for `null` service.");
417    return resolveChannel(type, configForService(type)).getChannel();
418  }
419
420  /**
421   * Provide acquired connections via injection-annotated {@link Channel} method or constructor parameters. This
422   * essentially proxies to {@link #acquire(GoogleService)}, passing in the service specified in the context of the
423   * {@link GoogleAPIChannel} annotation.
424   *
425   * @param context Intercepted method execution context.
426   * @return Resulting object.
427   * @throws TransportException If the connection could not be acquired.
428   */
429  @Override
430  public Channel intercept(MethodInvocationContext<Object, Channel> context) {
431    if (!context.hasAnnotation(GoogleAPIChannel.class)) {
432      throw new IllegalArgumentException(
433        "Must annotate method with @GoogleAPIChannel to inject from GoogleTransportManager.");
434    }
435    // fetch annotation and resolve desired service
436    @Nonnull AnnotationValue<GoogleAPIChannel> anno = Objects.requireNonNull(
437      context.getAnnotation(GoogleAPIChannel.class));
438    Optional<GoogleService> desiredService = anno.enumValue("service", GoogleService.class);
439    if (!desiredService.isPresent())
440      throw new IllegalArgumentException("Must provide desired service to GoogleTransportManager.");
441    return acquire(desiredService.get());
442  }
443}
